What Makes Modern C++ Compelling For Programmers? - Gareth Lloyd - ACCU York Meetup

---

What makes modern C++ compelling for programmers? In this talk, Gareth Lloyd explores the evolution of C++ from C++11 to C++23, highlighting features that make it a powerful, expressive, and ergonomic language for contemporary software development. Whether you are a seasoned developer or learning C++ for the first time, this session shows how modern C++ enables concise, type-safe, and efficient coding.

Learn about key features that differentiate modern C++:

- Strong typing and user-defined literals for safer and clearer code
- Ergonomic date and time handling with C++ chrono, zone_time, and formatting
- Compile-time programming with constexpr and consteval for faster and more predictable performance
- Operator overloading and domain-specific syntax for readable, expressive code
- Templates, class template argument deduction, and initializer lis
title: What Makes Modern C++ Compelling For Programmers? - Gareth Lloyd
